main event: At 0650 hrs on 6 Feb 1968, two observers sighted a reddish, brighter-than-a-commercial-jet object that moved westerly and was observed for about 6 hrs and 50 minutes.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 30 degrees in diameter and larger than a commercial jet airliner.
At the time of sighting, the planet Jupiter was in the south at a similar elevation and azimuth as the observed object.
The observers were trained surface location observers who had been observing satellites for over 2 years.
Another observer, Ed Was Shaw, reported seeing a small bluish-white light that rapidly changed direction and speed several times, which was described as not unusual and observed by many others.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes.
